This container validation on the GUI does no seem to work, when I choose a
project it displays the full path of the project instead of the name.
And sometimes allows me to click finish or not without real consistency.

SeB.
konrad, this is already fixed, right?

Bug 92999 has been fixed.  This one might be another code path leading to a 
problem or something different.  It needs to be investigated.

Which Eclipse build the problem appears in (the stack trace is from)?

SeB, could you try with recent build, and let know if the problems are still 
present.  Please provide steps to reproduce the stack, displaying full project 
name, or the finish button enabled.  Thanks.

Hello,

I have downloaded eclipse-SDK-I20050512-1739-win32.zip to check for the bug
again, and it is still there.
I import my own project, select the project node in the package explorer, then
choose new->Plugin development->extension point schema, type myid for "extension
point id" and myname for "extension point name" then finish and it fails with
the NPE.
I have try to create a new java project and do the same procedure and it worked.
So it seems to be coming from my personal project?
But bug is still there anyway.

Created an attachment (id=21340)
could not reproduce NPE but made a change that should fix bug

I still can't see how line 305 could have thrown an NPE given that the same 
variable was not null a few lines above.

In any event, at 305 the monitor is done anyways, and no reason to call 
monitor.done() again.

Keep in mind that the stack is from older build of Eclipse.  The line 305 is 
not the link 305 in the recent builds.  There was no reason to delete this 
line.

Seb, can you paste a stack trace and specify which Eclipse build (found in 
Help -> About) it is from.  Thanks.
It said 0512 in comment 4 and hence my total confusion.
You can see that you are even in different methods.

reopening to get feedback from user.  janek's patch should still go in, but 
that statement was redundant, yet harmless.

Hello,

At comment #1 stack trace where comming from M6 build I think, but my comment #4
was coming from a more recent build, sorry for not putting the stack trace.
How can I test the patch, where to download it from ?
Shall I wait for the next night build?
